title: multi-script typewriter samples
content:
anyone know where i can find images of [Greek](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Greek), [Cyrillic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Cyrillic), or Central European typewriter faces?

 [‹ point size + leading and centimeters](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15155 "Go to previous forum topic") [Guardian Re design ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15055 "Go to next forum topic")
author: paul d hunt

comments.content:
URW Courier has all three you are after.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/courier/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/courier/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/courier/")  
Tim
thanks, tim, great suggestion. i’m hoping to find some more authentic specimens, tho...

Hey!

Courier Bold Cyrillic is my favorite font. Period. In the whole world.

\_\_  
 [www.typeoff.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.typeoff.de/ "www.typeoff.de")

I was asked this recently by another designer, so prepared a sample of images of original Greek typewriter output, from legal documents. Some are from the second sheet (i.e. softer impression and transfer ink) but in these cases I have shot sections with corrections to the text, so bits with original strikes are alongside. All manual mechanical, plus one Selectric. Archive here: [http://www.leonidas.org/ftp/GLtw\_samples.gz](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.leonidas.org/ftp/GLtw_samples.gz "http://www.leonidas.org/ftp/GLtw\_samples.gz")

i found a Ukrainian typewriter sample here:  
 [http://www.2d.lviv.ua/download/Untitled-8.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906161723/http:/www.2d.lviv.ua/download/Untitled-8.jpg "http://www.2d.lviv.ua/download/Untitled-8.jpg")
